intro: Sonchus humilis, commonly known as lesser sowthistle, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring a rosette of spoon-shaped, hairy leaves that are often reddish in color. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, which are followed by spiny, oval-shaped seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Due to its rapid growth and adaptability, it is considered a common weed in many regions.
